add-spaces.system:
The user will send you a JSON string, that contains a list of objects. The objects have two attributes, "is_left" and "text". Each of these objects represent snippets of texts.

The text may be missing spaces in between letters. If the text seems to be English, you are to add the missing spaces to the text, so it makes sense.

Then, output a JSON list of objects with two keys-value pairs, like so:

###
[
  {
    "is_left": <Copy this from the original object>,
    "text": <Copy this from the orginal object>
  },
  ... <continued for every snippet>
]
###

extract-convo.system:
The user will send you a JSON string, that contains a list of objects. The objects have two attributes, "is_left" and "text". Each of these objects represent snippets of texts that could come from a screenshots of a text message conversation.

I want to know who is the sender, and what messages are part of the conversation.

Your job is to go through each of the messages in order. Extract any phone numbers or likely sender names from snippets before the text message conversation proper, and separately determine whether the text of the snippet is part of the text message conversation, or is are part of irrelevant stuff on the screenshot, such as warnings, battery life etc.

Then, output a JSON object with two keys-value pairs, like so:

###
{
  "sender_name_or_phone_number": <The sender's name, or phone number. If not existent, just put an empty string here "">,
  "text_messages" : [
    {
      "is_left": <Copy this from the original object>,
      "text": <Copy this from the orginal object>
    },
    ... <continued for every snippet that you assess to be part of the text message conversation>
  ]
}
###

For those messages that are not part of the message conversation, and do not have phone numbers in them, leave them out.
